topic.title: DITA For Publishers Java API and Tools
topic.shortdesc: The DITA for Publishers (D4P) Java API and tools provide a general-purpose API for DITA link management, as well as various utilities for working with collections of DITA documents. These APIs are intended to be a public and open API suitable for use by a variety of tools and applications, including DITA-aware editors, content management systems, and processors. The tools are intended to serve as both tests and demonstrations of the APIs as well as useful utilities.

body.p:
The D4P API (dita4publishers-dita-api.jar) provides the following general services and classes:
DITA Link Management service, which provides general facilities for working with DITA-defined links and addresses, especially the management of DITA key spaces and resolution of key references.
DITA key space classes and APIs
Conditional processing (filtering) services
DITA "bounded object set" (BOS) management. A DITA bounded object set is the set of resources (DITA documents and non-DITA resources) used in the context maps and topics ultimately used from a given root map.

The D4P Tools (dita4publishers-dita-impl.jar) provides the following tools and services:
MapBosReporterâ€”command-line application for constructing a DITA bounded object set and then reporting the BOS members, their dependencies, and any keys defined by the BOS's map tree.
DITA BOS classes and utilities for constructing DITA bounded object sets.
An in-memory DITA Link Management Service, which implements the link management API using a single in-memory implementation.
An in-memory DITA key space implementation (used by the link management service)
A general DITA utility class for working with DITA documents.
See the Javadocs for the API and implementation classes for details. These topics provide a general conceptual and design overview for the API and tools.
